{"abstract": "Chevron said first-quarter profit rose 9.5 percent, beating Wall Street estimates.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/03/business/03biztoday-CHEVRONPROFI_BRF.html", "snippet": "Chevron said first-quarter profit rose 9.5 percent, beating Wall Street estimates.", "lead_paragraph": "Chevron said first-quarter profit rose 9.5 percent, beating Wall Street estimates. Net income climbed to $5.17 billion, or $2.48 a share, from $4.72 billion, or $2.18, a year earlier, the company said. Petroleum output dropped 1.7 percent, however, to the equivalent of 2.6 million barrels of crude a day. Chevron\u2019s chief executive, David J. O\u2019Reilly, plans to spend more than $400 million a week this year in the company\u2019s costliest push ever to find new reserves, tap discoveries and expand refineries. {"abstract": "A combined blow from Hurricanes Gustav and Ike has shut down almost all oil and natural gas production in the Gulf of Mexico and handicapped refinery operations in Texas and Louisiana.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2008/09/15/business/15oil.html", "snippet": "A combined blow from Hurricanes Gustav and Ike has shut down almost all oil and natural gas production in the Gulf of Mexico and handicapped refinery operations in Texas and Louisiana.", "lead_paragraph": "HOUSTON \u0097 Oil companies were warning motorists on Sunday that they would not be able to produce adequate supplies of gasoline in the days ahead because so many of their refineries were still not operating in the aftermath of Hurricane Ike. {"abstract": "Chevron said it had video recordings of meetings in Ecuador that appear to reveal a bribery scheme tied to a $27 billion lawsuit the company faces over environmental damage at oil fields in the Amazon forest, The New York Times\u2019s Simon Romero and Clifford Krauss reported.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2009/09/01/chevron-offers-evidence-of-bribery-in-ecuador-suit/", "snippet": "Chevron said it had video recordings of meetings in Ecuador that appear to reveal a bribery scheme tied to a $27 billion lawsuit the company faces over environmental damage at oil fields in the Amazon forest, The New York Times\u2019s Simon Romero and ...", "lead_paragraph": "The oil giant Chevron said Monday that it had obtained video recordings of meetings in Ecuador this year that appear to reveal a bribery scheme connected to a $27 billion lawsuit the company faces over environmental damage at oil fields it operated in remote areas of the Amazon forest in Ecuador, The New York Times\u2019s Simon Romero and Clifford Krauss reported. {"abstract": "The Chevron Corporation reported fourth-quarter sales and refining profits that failed to meet analysts\u2019 estimates on Friday.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/29/business/29chevron.html", "snippet": "The Chevron Corporation reported fourth-quarter sales and refining profits that failed to meet analysts\u2019 estimates on Friday.", "lead_paragraph": "The Chevron Corporation reported fourth-quarter sales and refining profits that failed to meet analysts\u2019 estimates on Friday. Chevron said profit rose to $5.3 billion, or $2.64 a share, compared with $3.07 billion, or $1.53 a share, a year earlier. Sales rose to $54.03 billion, from $48.68 billion, but fell short of the $58.8 billion analysts had expected. The company\u2019s refineries in the United States performed \u201cworse than expected,\u201d contributing less to the bottom line than anticipated, said Paul Cheng, an analyst in New York at Barclays. Profit in Chevron\u2019s worldwide oil- and gas-production business rose 16 percent, to $4.85 billion, compared with a year earlier, the company said. Earnings from the unit\u2019s operations in the United States fell 13 percent, to $930 million. ", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Chevron Reports Disappointing Sales", "kicker": "Business Briefing | Energy", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Chevron Reports Disappointing Sales", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Chevron Corp", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-01-29T01:53:39+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Bloomberg News", "person": [{"firstname": "Bloomberg", "middlename": null, "lastname": "News", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Brief", "_id": "nyt://article/3dd6d624-e572-57a6-81c5-4e3f0fad04b8", "word_count": 124, "uri": "nyt://article/3dd6d624-e572-57a6-81c5-4e3f0fad04b8"}

{"abstract": "Valero Energy agreed on Friday to buy Chevron\u2019s refinery in Pembroke, Wales, for $730 million and other related assets for about $1 billion.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/03/12/business/12bizbriefs-VALEROAGREES_BRF.html", "snippet": "Valero Energy agreed on Friday to buy Chevron\u2019s refinery in Pembroke, Wales, for $730 million and other related assets for about $1 billion.", "lead_paragraph": "Valero Energy agreed on Friday to buy Chevron\u2019s refinery in Pembroke, Wales, for $730 million and other related assets for about $1 billion. The transaction is the latest move by a big oil company to refocus on exploration instead of less lucrative refining operations. Chevron has already agreed to sell refining assets in more than 20 countries, and it is looking to sell more operations in the Caribbean and Central America. The deal also gives Valero, a major American oil refiner, its first significant foothold in Europe. The Pembroke refinery has a capacity of 270,000 barrels of oil a day, the vast majority of which is crude. Valero said it expected the purchase to immediately add to its earnings per share. ", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Valero Agrees to Buy an Oil Refinery in Wales", "kicker": "Business Briefing | Acquisitions", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Valero Agrees to Buy an Oil Refinery in Wales", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "VALERO ENERGY CORP", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-03-12T02:54:09+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Michael J. de la Merced", "person": [{"firstname": "Michael", "middlename": "J.", "lastname": "de la Merced", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Brief", "_id": "nyt://article/50ce6210-55dd-564f-aef4-92035e6b1d6b", "word_count": 124, "uri": "nyt://article/50ce6210-55dd-564f-aef4-92035e6b1d6b"}

{"abstract": "Chevron faces fines of as much as $83 million for an oil spill this month off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, the authorities said Monday.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/22/business/energy-environment/brazil-chevron-faces-fines-of-83-million-in-oil-spill.html", "snippet": "Chevron faces fines of as much as $83 million for an oil spill this month off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, the authorities said Monday.", "lead_paragraph": " Chevron faces fines of as much as $83 million for an  oil spill this month off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, the authorities said Monday. The fines reflect the government\u2019s anger over Chevron\u2019s handling of the spill. Chevron may also face additional fines and legal penalties, officials said. Haroldo Lima, head of the National Petroleum Agency, said the spill could complicate Chevron\u2019s hopes of gaining access to new offshore exploration areas. Federal investigators said Chevron employees might also face prison terms. Chevron said in a statement that it had not yet received official notice of any fines and would respond if it did. ", "print_section": "A", "print_page": "8", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Brazil: Chevron Faces Fines of $83 Million in Oil Spill", "kicker": "World Briefing | The Americas", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Brazil: Chevron Faces Fines of $83 Million in Oil Spill", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "Chevron Corporation", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Accidents and Safety", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Oil Spills", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Offshore Drilling and Exploration", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Oil (Petroleum) and Gasoline", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Fines (Penalties)", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "Brazil", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}, {"name": "glocations", "value": "Rio de Janeiro (Brazil)", "rank": 8, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2011-11-22T00:34:25+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Foreign", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Energy & Environment ", "byline": {"original": "By Simon Romero", "person": [{"firstname": "Simon", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Romero", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "Brief", "_id": "nyt://article/9a35d0d2-2d51-5cf1-a679-08f13855ec34", "word_count": 106, "uri": "nyt://article/9a35d0d2-2d51-5cf1-a679-08f13855ec34"}

{"abstract": "Chevron\u2019s fourth-quarter profit declined to $5.1 billion, or $2.58 a share, from $5.3 billion, or $2.64, a year earlier.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/28/business/profit-slips-for-chevron-and-disappoints-analysts.html", "snippet": "Chevron\u2019s fourth-quarter profit declined to $5.1 billion, or $2.58 a share, from $5.3 billion, or $2.64, a year earlier.", "lead_paragraph": "Chevron\u2019s fourth-quarter profit declined to $5.1 billion, or $2.58 a share, from $5.3 billion, or $2.64, a year earlier. Its earnings per share were 32 cents below the average of five analysts\u2019 estimates compiled by Bloomberg. Sales rose 11 percent to nearly $60 billion during the quarter. Chevron\u2019s American refineries lost an average $2.2 million a day during the final three months of 2011 as crude-processing margins shrank and maintenance work at a California plant curbed fuel output, the company said in a statement. Chevron added the equivalent of 1.67 billion barrels in reserves last year, enough to replace 171 percent of the oil and gas the company pumped last year. {"abstract": "Chevron missed first-quarter profit and sales estimates as falling production blunted the impact of surging oil prices", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/28/business/energy-environment/chevron-misses-forecasts-despite-higher-oil-prices.html", "snippet": "Chevron missed first-quarter profit and sales estimates as falling production blunted the impact of surging oil prices", "lead_paragraph": "Chevron missed first-quarter profit and sales estimates as falling production blunted the impact of surging oil prices. Net income rose 4.2 percent to $6.47 billion, or $3.27 a share, from $6.21 billion, or $3.09 a share, a year earlier, the company said. Sales rose 0.8 percent to $58.9 billion, 7.8 percent lower than the average of three analysts\u2019 estimates compiled by Bloomberg. Stock in Chevron, which is based in San Ramon, Calif., fell 2 cents, or 0.02 percent, to $106.20 a share. {"abstract": "Chevron subpoenaed a hedge fund\u2019s shareholder proposals as it tries to find ammunition in its fight against an $18 billion judgment in Ecuador.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2012/12/09/business/chevron-takes-aim-at-an-activist-shareholder.html", "snippet": "Chevron subpoenaed a hedge fund\u2019s shareholder proposals as it tries to find ammunition in its fight against an $18 billion judgment in Ecuador.", "lead_paragraph": "PUBLIC corporations routinely tell shareholders that their views matter. The Chevron Corporation, for example, said in its 2012 proxy statement: \u201cYour board welcomes dialogue on the topics presented in the stockholder proposals on the following pages.\u201d So it might seem odd that last month Chevron subpoenaed one of its investors, Trillium Asset Management, which has sponsored numerous shareholder proposals at Chevron over the years. The oil company demanded documents related to those proposals. {"abstract": "In testimony prepared for delivery in court next week, Steven Donziger is as defiant as ever, even as he acknowledges mistakes.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/14/business/energy-environment/lawyer-concedes-mistakes-in-chevron-case.html", "snippet": "In testimony prepared for delivery in court next week, Steven Donziger is as defiant as ever, even as he acknowledges mistakes.", "lead_paragraph": "For the last month, Chevron has presented a parade of witnesses against Steven R. {"abstract": "A lawyer for the oil company questioned Steven R. {"abstract": "The pipeline group Kinder Morgan plans to reorganize as a single corporation. | The drop in Treasury yields has confounded experts. | An investor group is considering legal action after being burned by losses on Portuguese bank bonds. | A Stanford finance professor is rapidly gaining a broader audience.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/08/11/morning-agenda-kinder-morgan-to-consolidate/", "snippet": "The pipeline group Kinder Morgan plans to reorganize as a single corporation. | The drop in Treasury yields has confounded experts. | An investor group is considering legal action after being burned by losses on Portuguese bank bonds. | A Stanford...", "lead_paragraph": "KINDER MORGAN TO REORGANIZE | The pipeline group Kinder Morgan, the biggest of the master limited partnerships, announced on Sunday that it would acquire its three associated companies and reorganize as one corporation based in Houston, DealBook\u2019s David Gelles writes. The new Kinder Morgan will have an estimated enterprise value of about $140 billion \u2012 $100 billion of market value and $40 billion of debt \u2012 making it the third-biggest energy company in the United States, after Exxon Mobil and Chevron.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Morning Agenda: Kinder Morgan to Consolidate", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2014-08-11T12:53:35+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Sydney Ember", "person": [{"firstname": "Sydney", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ember", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/842ea6ba-b42f-5636-bc14-f23cc666bcd2", "word_count": 1896, "uri": "nyt://article/842ea6ba-b42f-5636-bc14-f23cc666bcd2"}

{"abstract": "Energy experts said the sudden increase could be explained by various factors, including reports that the Islamic State terrorist group was advancing in an offensive near Iraq\u2019s northern oil fields.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/01/31/business/energy-environment/oil-prices-surge-8-after-long-slide-down.html", "snippet": "Energy experts said the sudden increase could be explained by various factors, including reports that the Islamic State terrorist group was advancing in an offensive near Iraq\u2019s northern oil fields.", "lead_paragraph": "HOUSTON \u2014 Oil prices suddenly spiked more than 8 percent on Friday, in the biggest one-day price move for the volatile commodity in nearly three years.
